dialogueTree.title: Karaoke Stand: "The stage is all set up for your pe..."
dialogueTree.text: The stage is all set up for your performance. Feels... silent. You can hear the pellets creak under your feet.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You feel a little dizzy. A little *..."
links.text: You feel a little dizzy. A little *unsteady*, suddenly.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""So, are you ready for your... *thi..."
links.text: "So, are you ready for your... *thing* now? Let me know when I should turn on the karaoke carousel."

links.title: You: ""Look, Kim, I'm going to sing karao..."
links.text: "Look, Kim, I'm going to sing karaoke!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I can see that." The lieutenant st..."
links.text: "I can see that." The lieutenant steps away from the stage, ready for your performance.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, you're not. The *bills*, remem..."
links.text: "No, you're not. The *bills*, remember?"

links.title: You: "Put your lips against the microphon..."
links.text: Put your lips against the microphone -- test it.

links.title: Karaoke Stand: "Immediately a loud feedback noise s..."
links.text: Immediately a loud feedback noise startles the room. You feel like an amateur. How are you supposed to hold the mic? Should you just *sing* into it? Where should you stand?

links.title: Interfacing: "Hands... Where do you put your *han..."
links.text: Hands... Where do you put your *hands*?!

links.title: Endurance: "Does someone feel like throwing up?..."
links.text: Does someone feel like throwing up? I do. A little.

links.title: You: "Look around the room first."
links.text: Look around the room first.

links.title: Karaoke Stand: "It's still early here. Faint daylig..."
links.text: It's still early here. Faint daylight is seeping into the dining hall. All the tables have been wiped pristine clean for the customers to come...

links.title: Karaoke Stand: "Someone's making coffee in the kitc..."
links.text: Someone's making coffee in the kitchen, but aside from that no one's really around yet. It would be a much better idea to perform in the evening, no?

links.title: Half Light: "Yes. You can always do it in the ev..."
links.text: Yes. You can always do it in the evening. It will be less scary with a lot of people.

links.title: Karaoke Stand: "There are *some* people out there,..."
links.text: There are *some* people out there, but mostly -- a post meridian slumber has fallen on the premise. Not super lively. It would be wiser to perform in the evening, no? But the choice is yours...

links.title: Karaoke Stand: "The bar is full and buzzing with ch..."
links.text: The bar is full and buzzing with chatter. No one is paying you any attention, but still you feel your knees turn to noodles. Okay, now a couple is looking at you! Even worse...

links.title: Physical Instrument: "You're sweating..."
links.text: You're sweating...

links.title: Inland Empire: "They are going to hate you."
links.text: They are going to hate you.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Just... just make sure you move, ok..."
links.text: Just... just make sure you move, okay? Don't be stiff.

links.title: Karaoke Stand: "The dining hall has cleared up of c..."
links.text: The dining hall has cleared up of customers for tonight. Even the kitchen is closed, and someone has turned down the lights. Maybe it's a good idea to do it in the dark like this? Almost after closing hours...

links.title: You: ""I'm ready, Garte. Hit play.""
links.text: "I'm ready, Garte. Hit play."

links.title: Drama: "The air is thick with anticipation."
links.text: The air is thick with anticipation.

links.title: Drama: "Someone dims the lights as the musi..."
links.text: Someone dims the lights as the music starts... Okay. Here we go...

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: ""I would often go there. To the tin..."
links.text:
"I would often go there. To the tiny church there. The smallest church in Saint-Saëns -- though it once was larger.

How the rill may rest there. Down through the mist there. Toward the seven sisters -- toward those pale cliffs there

I would often stay there. In the tiny yard there. I have been so glad here -- looking forward to the past here

But now you are alone. None of this matters at all."

links.title: Drama: "A lazy applause fills the room. You..."
links.text: A lazy applause fills the room. You feel your hands shake as awareness of your body returns to you.

links.title: You: "Thank you, Ancient Reptilian Brain."
links.text: Thank you, Ancient Reptilian Brain.

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "There is silence now in the deep wh..."
links.text: There is silence now in the deep where the voice came from. It has receded -- to return only in dreams and nightmares.

links.title: Drama: "This guy really carried you."
links.text: This guy really carried you.

links.title: You: ""I want dedicate this song to whoev..."
links.text: "I want dedicate this song to whoever wrote me that fucking letter. I still love you. Thank you very much, asshole."

links.title: Karaoke Stand: "The microphone amplifies your voice..."
links.text: The microphone amplifies your voice in an uncomfortable manner. Someone coughs. Most people have gone back to talking now.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Good, good," the cafeteria manager..."
links.text: "Good, good," the cafeteria manager intervenes to cut the moment short. "Are we ready? I want to unplug the microphone now."

links.title: Drama: "Last words?"
links.text: Last words?

links.title: You: ""I'd like to dedicate this song to..."
links.text: "I'd like to dedicate this song to my partner, Kim, even though he's not here right now."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant doesn't say anything..."
links.text: The lieutenant doesn't say anything, but gives you a quick smile, before turning away.

links.title: Composure: "He's incapable of blushing, but if..."
links.text: He's incapable of blushing, but if he weren't -- he'd blush.

links.title: You: ""I'd like to dedicate this song to..."
links.text: "I'd like to dedicate this song to Garte for letting me sing it. It's all shit, Garte."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes, well..." He clearly doesn't k..."
links.text: "Yes, well..." He clearly doesn't know how to respond -- your words caught him by surprise. "I'm just doing my job, that's all."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""But uh, are you done now? Can I un..."
links.text: "But uh, are you done now? Can I unplug the microphone? I'd like to unplug the microphone." He's ready for things to get back to normal.

links.title: You: ""It's been an honour." [Bow and lea..."
links.text: "It's been an honour." [Bow and leave.]

links.title: You: "[Whip out your finger pistols, shoo..."
links.text: [Whip out your finger pistols, shoot in the air and leave.]

links.title: You: ""Evening will come, we will sew the..."
links.text: "Evening will come, we will sew the white sail! Workers of the world, unite!" [Leave.]

links.title: You: ""Thank you, Martinaise." [Leave.]"
links.text: "Thank you, Martinaise." [Leave.]

links.title: You: "[Say nothing. Leave enigmatically.]"
links.text: [Say nothing. Leave enigmatically.]

links.title: You: ""I'd like to dedicate this song to..."
links.text: "I'd like to dedicate this song to the pale nothing that will devour the world."

links.title: You: ""I'd like to dedicate this song to..."
links.text: "I'd like to dedicate this song to Contact Mike. Everyone else *sucks*."

links.title: You: ""I'd like to dedicate this song to..."
links.text: "I'd like to dedicate this song to the RCM. Please don't fire me."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant doesn't say anything..."
links.text: The lieutenant doesn't say anything -- but he smiles sadly.

links.title: You: ""I don't want to dedicate this song..."
links.text: "I don't want to dedicate this song to anyone. I performed it for myself."

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: ""I would often go there. To the tin..."
links.text:
"I would often go there. To the tiny church there. The smallest church in Saint-Saëns -- though it once was larger.

How the rill may rest there. Down through the mist there. Toward the seven sisters -- toward those pale cliffs there

I would often stay there. In the tiny yard there. I have been so glad here -- looking forward to the past here

But now you are alone. None of this matters at all."

links.title: Drama: "The air is thick with anticipation."
links.text: The air is thick with anticipation.

links.title: Drama: "The tape clicks into the carousel a..."
links.text: The tape clicks into the carousel and then the music starts...

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: ""I would often go there. To the tin..."
links.text:
"I would often go there. To the tiny church there. The smallest church in Saint-Saëns -- though it once was larger.

How the rill may rest there. Down through the mist there. Toward the seven sisters -- toward those pale cliffs there

I would often stay there. In the tiny yard there. I have been so glad here -- looking forward to the past here

But now you are alone. None of this matters at all."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "A rather lonely applause echoes thr..."
links.text: A rather lonely applause echoes through the mostly empty cafeteria. It's Garte. "Not bad," he tells you with an approving nod.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes. Not bad at all." The lieutena..."
links.text: "Yes. Not bad at all." The lieutenant joins in. You feel your hands shake as awareness of your body returns to you.

links.title: You: "Thank you, Ancient Reptilian Brain."
links.text: Thank you, Ancient Reptilian Brain.

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "No reply. There is silence now in t..."
links.text: No reply. There is silence now in the deep where the voice came from. It has receded into you, to return only in dreams and nightmares.

links.title: You: ""Thank you. I don't need big crowds..."
links.text: "Thank you. I don't need big crowds, I just need my friends."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Okay. Yes. I'm going to unplug the..."
links.text: "Okay. Yes. I'm going to unplug the microphone, so you can get off the stage now."

links.title: You: ""Life is a fucking joke.""
links.text: "Life is a fucking joke."

links.title: You: ""Thanks for bearing with me. I'm go..."
links.text: "Thanks for bearing with me. I'm gonna get back to work now."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Uhm... yes. I'm going to unplug th..."
links.text: "Uhm... yes. I'm going to unplug the microphone, okay?" He unplugs it.

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: ""I would often go there. To the tin..."
links.text:
"I would often go there. To the tiny church there. The smallest church in Saint-Saëns -- though it once was larger.

How the rill may rest there. Down through the mist there. Toward the seven sisters -- toward those pale cliffs there

I would often stay there. In the tiny yard there. I have been so glad here -- looking forward to the past here

But now you are alone. None of this matters at all."

links.title: Drama: "The air is thick with anticipation."
links.text: The air is thick with anticipation.

links.title: Drama: "Someone dims the lights as the musi..."
links.text: Someone dims the lights as the music starts. A lump's in your throat suddenly...

links.title: Limbic System: ""I would often go there. To the tin..."
links.text:
"I would often go there. To the tiny church there. The smallest church in Saint-Saëns -- though it once was larger.

How the rill may rest there. Down through the mist there. Toward the seven sisters -- toward those pale cliffs there

I would often stay there. In the tiny yard there. I have been so glad here -- looking forward to the past here

But now you are alone. None of this matters at all."

links.title: Drama: "Do you hear that? It's the most pat..."
links.text: Do you hear that? It's the most pathetic applause in the world, Harry. Made of pity. No one *liked* you.

links.title: Drama: "Do you hear that? The most pathetic..."
links.text: Do you hear that? The most pathetic applause in the world. Made of pity. No one *liked* you -- they think you're a joke.

links.title: Drama: "Did you hear that? The most patheti..."
links.text: Did you hear that? The most pathetic applause in the world. Made of pity. No matter the time of day, or how small the audience -- this is a *pitiful* applause.

links.title: You: "Say: "You *didn't* like it, huh?""
links.text: Say: "You *didn't* like it, huh?"

links.title: Karaoke Stand: "Your words echo in the karaoke mic...."
links.text: Your words echo in the karaoke mic. People talk in the distance. A couple tries not to look at you.

links.title: Glen: ""Quit yellin' into the mic!" You he..."
links.text: "Quit yellin' into the mic!" You hear from the Union booth.

links.title: Karaoke Stand: "Your words echo in the karaoke mic...."
links.text: Your words echo in the karaoke mic. They sound sparse. The room is almost empty.

links.title: You: ""I'm up here singing my fucking HEA..."
links.text: "I'm up here singing my fucking HEART OUT and it's not *good enough* for you fuckers!?"

links.title: Karaoke Stand: "You hear -- or *think* you hear --..."
links.text: You hear -- or *think* you hear -- uncomfortable shifting around. A bit of laughter, maybe? No one's saying anything.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Uhm... I'm gonna unplug the mic no..."
links.text: "Uhm... I'm gonna unplug the mic now, okay?"

links.title: You: ""You don't know what good singing i..."
links.text: "You don't know what good singing is! This is *real* singing. I sang about *real* stuff."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""That's it, I'm unplugging it." He..."
links.text: "That's it, I'm unplugging it." He presses stop on the tape carousel. You hear a little whine of feedback and then the mic dies in your hand.

links.title: Interfacing: "That's it. You're unpowered."
links.text: That's it. You're unpowered.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let's go, officer." The lieutenant..."
links.text: "Let's go, officer." The lieutenant closes his notes. "These people wouldn't know a good performance if it bit them in the ass."

links.title: You: ""You... liked it?""
links.text: "You... liked it?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes," he bows lightly. "It was dow..."
links.text: "Yes," he bows lightly. "It was downright tragic, detective."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "I mean it, he thinks."
links.text: I mean it, he thinks.

links.title: Conceptualization: "To him, being a cop in the RCM was..."
links.text: To him, being a cop in the RCM was truly expressed in that performance.

links.title: You: "[Put down the mic.]"
links.text: [Put down the mic.]

links.title: You: ""Fuck you! I gave it my fucking bes..."
links.text: "Fuck you! I gave it my fucking best. I gave it EVERYTHING and you SHIT on me?!"

links.title: Shanky: "A voice from the back squeaks somet..."
links.text: A voice from the back squeaks something. It's definitely laughter.

links.title: Karaoke Stand: "Someone walks out of the room -- by..."
links.text: Someone walks out of the room -- by the front door. Some woman. Is it because of you?

links.title: You: ""I SANG ABOUT HOW I FEEL! Fuck all..."
links.text: "I SANG ABOUT HOW I FEEL! Fuck all you, scum!"

links.title: You: "Just stand there."
links.text: Just stand there.

links.title: Limbic System: ""I would often go there. To the tin..."
links.text:
"I would often go there. To the tiny church there. The smallest church in Saint-Saëns -- though it once was larger.

How the rill may rest there. Down through the mist there. Toward the seven sisters -- toward those pale cliffs there

I would often stay there. In the tiny yard there. I have been so glad here -- looking forward to the past here

But now you are alone. None of this matters at all."

links.title: Drama: "The air is thick with anticipation."
links.text: The air is thick with anticipation.

links.title: Drama: "The tape clicks into the carousel a..."
links.text: The tape clicks into the carousel and then the music starts... God, a lump's in your throat suddenly...

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What are you doing? I told you it..."
links.text: "What are you doing? I told you it was for customers only. I'm not turning on the karaoke carousel unless you pay your bills."

links.title: Volition: "He's not backing up from this. Stan..."
links.text: He's not backing up from this. Standing up here is merely a practice run without paying him first.
